subject: Design
title: The Zipper: The Fastener That Almost Didn't Happen
description: A short lesson to help you apply The Zipper: The Fastener That Almost Didn't Happen.

hook.text: The zipper took 40 years and three inventors to get right. Buttons almost won forever.

buildup.text: Whitcomb Judson patented a 'clasp locker' in 1893, but it jammed constantly and wouldn't stay closed.

discovery.text: Gideon Sundback redesigned it in 1913 with interlocking teeth and a slider â€” the modern zipper.

twist.text: B.F. Goodrich named it 'zipper' from the sound it makes. Before that, nobody had a catchy word for it.

climax.text: The zipper shows that great industrial design often needs decades of iteration, not a single eureka moment.

punchline.text: 40 years of failure gave us something we now use without thinking.

quiz.question: How long did the zipper take to develop into its modern form?
options: About 20 years from first patent to working design
It worked perfectly from the start
